divs: sighting detailsthe observer saw object on june 25, 2011. the time was around 9:00 p.m. est. mr. hammill was sitting on his deck while on vacation looking out over the ocean. some clouds were observed. mr. hammill observed an object high above the ocean. he estimated about 1\2 mile elevation. the object appeared very bright and he noticed the object blinked on for 60-80 seconds without moving. he noticed the size was compared to a very bright star, but much bigger. the object was not pulsating. the object then blinked off and about two minutes later blinked on again. the object followed this pattern three times. no other aircraft were observed in the general area. mr. hammill was a member of the u.s. navy and is familiar with aircraft configurations and navigational light.
trends: There have been 52 other sightings in Myrtle Beach
There was one other sighting in Myrtle Beach on or around June 25th 2011
Summary: Star like object observed off Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
